title: Ticket #4128: Perform RPATH tricks on python modules for UW-style compiles
description:
Igor pointed out that, to use the python bindings with a tarball-based install, you need to customize both PYTHONPATH (so python finds the module) and LD_LIBRARY_PATH (so the dynamic loader can load the module).

Using RPATH tricks (similar to what we do with libcondor_utils.so already) we could simplify this setup so LD_LIBRARY_PATH doesn't need to be set. LD_LIBRARY_PATH is the more annoying of the two because, unlike PYTHONPATH, it can't be manipulated during the python runtime.
remarks:
2014-Jan-02 08:54:34 by bbockelm:
This is now done. If you are using a tarball-based install, then you only need to set PYTHONPATH and not LD_LIBRARY_PATH.

(FWIW, RPATH was set in these libraries - but it was not adjusted for the fact that they live in a different directory from the rest of the condor libraries.)
